34.title: Sensors not working on Pixel 3 XL
34.content:
Already submitted bug report on https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/129361805 but checking if there's anyone else had same issue.

I got new Pixel 3 XL last Saturday. Finished all settings and apps as usual, then enrolled Android Q beta, OTAed from latest Pie build of 20190305. 

First I noticed that auto rotation and Active edge is not working, so I downloaded Sensor Lab and Phone Test from play store and run a test. As you can see from attached screenshots, the result of these two apps along with GPS status' sensor test shows that accelerometer, gyroscope, compass and step counter are not working. 

My first thought is it's a bug in Q beta because before installing OTA everything worked as expected. Then I did a hard reset via recovery, downloaded latest Pie factory image (190305) and flash-all. However this operation did not help. Those sensors are still dead.

I had several Nexus/Pixel devices, tried many beta images and 3rd party ROMs but this issue is new to me. Since I'm in mainland China it's difficult to just call customer service and get a new handset. Looking for help here.

P.S Base on my experience as a software developer I tend to believe it's not a hardware issue, but is it possible that I really need to get a new phone since the bug made some permanent damage?


Thanks a lot.

35.title: Google Pixel 1 - GPS Drifts up to 1 mile away (Not on Android 10)
35.content:
Since 3.5 weeks ago, my GPS dot suddenly started drifting around the map (sometimes up to a mile away) when driving OR simply just sitting at home, using Google Maps.

I can easily reproduce the issue by just sitting at home and trying to navigate somewhere on Google Maps, and watching the dot jump around.

Aside from Factory Data Reset, I've actually replaced the phone with not one, but two like-new refurbished phones. I am still experiencing the same exact issue.

I've double-checked enabling all location services/accuracy (I always have them enabled in general). Tried the usual "turn it off and turn it on again" of course.
One phone I tried testing with the Android 10 update. The other phone (that I currently have), I *did not* update to Android 10. Both phones have the same issue.
I've tried clearing Google Maps data/cache
Used a GPS repair app to clear GPS cache/recalibrate it.
Replaced the SIM card with a brand new card (twice)
My wife has a Google Pixel of the exact same model (Pixel 1) as me, but a different network (she is on AT&T, I am on Verizon) and has no problems at all. So I don't think it's our environment (walls, vehicle) causing problems.
Also, this problem only started happening recently, after working fine for 2 years.

To summarize:
Phone 1 - Google Pixel - Android 10 - Verizon - GPS drifts (after working fine for 2 years), bought in 2018
Phone 2 - Google Pixel - Android 10 - Verizon - GPS drifts, "like-new" refurbished by Asurion in 2020
Phone 3 - Google Pixel - Android 9 - Verizon - GPS drifts, "like-new" refurbished by Asurion in 2020
Phone 4 - Google Pixel - Android 10 - AT&T - GPS works fine, bought in 2018
Edit:

Also tested swapping the SIM cards in Phone 3 and Phone 4. After swapping the SIM cards, Phone 4 reproduced the issue and Phone 3 worked perfectly.

Verizon insists the issue isn't on their end (I contacted technical support).

Is there anything else I can do?

36.title: Does the Fit app "learn" over time?
36.content:
For the Fit app, I found that the step count is pretty accurate (compared to my Fitbit), but it doesn't understand that I have a long stride. So by the end of the walk, distance is off by a mile or more.  With Fitbit, you could tell it your stride length and that made it really accurate. I really wish you could do this for Google Fit. 
My question: I did notice that if you "track" a workout, the mileage becomes extremely accurate.  I'm wondering if I did this on enough occasions, that google would eventually learn my average stride length and remember? once it's accurate enough, then it could just use the accelerometer and not GPS for mileage -- like a Fitbit.
note: I'm not trying to keep track of accurate steps / mileage all day long. I don't even wear my Fitbit all day. I just bring it on walks to see how far I went. but it's getting old and I'd like the phone to be a good replacement.

51.title: Pixel 2 gps accuracy in europe (GALILEO). Could it be improved? (comparison vs Pixel 4)
51.content:
Hi All 

I'm user of a Pixel 2 and Pixel 4. 

I noticed that the Pixel 4 is very accurate (regarding the compass direction) in Europe old towns (like in Barcelona old quarters with very narrow streets).

This is the first phone that gives me a good accuracy here (at least so far). 
Compass is always 80-100% pointing in the right direction.

I decided to compare Pixel 2 vs Pixel 4 and I noticed the following:

When opening "GPSTest" app in the Pixel 2, only 1 default GALILEO Satellite appears. And then the phone basically stays with 1-2 satellites, but it struggles to find them. 

When opening "GPSTest" app in Pixel 4, more than 4-5 GALILEO Satellites appear right after launching the app. And then a few more might appear, but that probably is not that required.

And finally: I also noticed that if I put Pixel 4 close to my Pixel 2 while the app is open, the Pixel 2 start to catch a lot of more galileo sattelites (Like if the Pixel 4 was enhancing the Pixel 2) --> Anyway, this last case,is weird, but I tried it two times only, maybe I need to try it more times, to confirm is not a placebo. (But the Pixel 2 didn't seem to catch lot of european sattelites by its own, without the Pixel 4 doing the same).

Now my main question about all this topic is: 

Is it possible to add more gallileo sattelites to the Pixel 2 configuration? Perhaps this improves the bad the GPS accuracy in some european places? 
I think the Pixel 2 is missing some sattelites in some config file. Could be possible to increase the initial satellite count from 0/29 to 0/37 like the Pixel 4? 

I'm just trying to know if it's possible to improve the GPS accuracy in Europe with the Pixel 2. 

Here we have some screenshots. 


Pixel 2 (when app starts, only 1 European satellite - so 0/29 instead 0/37): 


Pixel 2 (after putting Pixel 4 and Pixel 2 using GPS together, or at least, after letting Pixel 2 use the GPS for some time): 


Pixel 4 after opening the app (0/37): 



Thanks
Sebastian

85.title: GPS takes a long time to start navigation both on Waze and on Google Maps.
85.content:
The GPS takes a very long time to start navigation. It's not due to slow internet connection as I checked my speed was well above 50 Mbps when the issue occurred. 

On some occasions the navigation would start off fine and suddenly lose GPS signal in the middle of navigation and would not recover to find the GPS signal.

The issue started arising after the December update. A fix that I have found to have worked on Reddit was to clear the maps' cache, disable improve location accuracy under Google Location Accuracy, restart the phone and re-enable improve location accuracy.

This fix however is temporary as the issue would arise again after 2-3 trips on any of the navigation apps. If anyone out there knows a permanent solution to this issue, please help.

93.title: S21+ restarting issues and how to get a replacement.
93.content: I have a S21+.  I have had it right around 60 days now.  This phone shuts itself off and restarts at least 10+ more times a day. Sometimes it will restart its around 60 days now. This phone restarts at least 10+ more times a day. Sometimes it will restart itself 4 or more times in a row. Off, on, off,on....I have been desperately trying to get a replacement from Samsung. I have done all the trouble shooting that I was told to do. I have done a factory reset. This is a work phone, and I have lost many, many work opportunities, due to my unstable phone. I have been in the middle of a conversation with a client, hoping to land the job that they are offering, and my phone will restart. Very unprofessional. My phone will restart while using GPS, it will restart while using one of my work apps, and then I need to go back in and re-enter all the information again. I have been told several times by Samsung, I contact them almost every other day, to send it in and they will look at it. That is not an option, I need my phone for work. This is not a personal phone. And I do not feel I should have to go out and buy another phone, to use while I send mine in to see if they can repair it. My other option is to drive over 2 hours one way, to the closest Samsung Tech, and have them look at it. That is really not an option, since I would have to take a day off work to do this. I think with this many complaints, that Samsung would want to stand behind their products and not get a bad reputation. If I had purchased this through my cellular company, they would have given me a replacement on the spot. But I purchased this straight through Samsung, and they act like it is the consumers fault that their phones are having these restarting issues. If this was an Apple phone, Apple would have sent a replacement over night. So, my question to this community, has anyone had luck with getting a replacement with out having to jump through hoops? And if so, do you have issue with the new phone that you were sent?

119.title: Galaxy S9 and S9+ dropping wifi
119.content:
As the subject says, then our Galaxy phones in this home just keep dropping the wifi.
Here is what we have tried so far:
1. Updating all phones as well as the router
2. Turning off hotspot 2.0
3. Turning off 5 Ghz
4. Turning off 2.4 Ghz and only run on the 5 Ghz
5. Every change included restarting router and phones!
6. Turning on GPS, turning off GPS
7. Turning on Mobile Data, turning off Mobile data
8. Downloaded package sniffers to see what the heck the phone was up to!
9. Run with static IP for the phones, turned off static IP for phones
and probably a few more things I cannot even remember as I write to you right now.
  Funny thing though. I have devices that use 2.4 Ghz and/or 5 Ghz, but they have no problems. We got iPhones and iPads in the household, they got no problems. But the durned Samsung GS9/9+ just doesn't want to wifi.
When it turns on, it shows exclamation mark, as soon as I have done any of the things described further up, it shows wifi without exclamation mark. Give it 2 minutes and the wifi still shows as running, but all connection is lost and then it only turns on a few seconds to then break connection.
I have been in contact with Samsung who gave up on me...
I have tried to solve the problem on my own by checking out other routers and how they solved the problem, issue is...
The problem is Samsung, the way you have programmed the drivers to deal with the wifi.
The answering time from the phone is too slow. Those who created opensource software for the routers stated, that the only way to keep the connection with the Samsung phone, was by allowing the reply of the handshake with the phone to last forever, otherwise it would drop again...
  Please fix this issue Samsung, this is on you!

129.title: Galaxy A8: picture location and GPS resolution
129.content:
Android phones enable cameras to add location information to jpg pictures taken by camera application.
GPS latitude and longitude are packed into EXIF segment of jpg file. The accuracy of GPS data depends on the GPS satellite signal strength and on GPS receiver in the phone.
I tested ma Galaxy A8 phone with GeoTracker app and I'm very satisfied with it. But I was disappointed when I found out that resolution of GPS location data in jpg pictures was 1 (one) arc second. It means about 30 meters for latitude, while the resolution of longitude depends on the latitude.
I checked a few photos from other devices: Sony Xperia M, Garmin VIRB Ultra 30, Huawei VTR-L09, Xiaomi Redmi 4X and LG-V700 tablet. Resolutions are 1/1000, 1/1000000, 1/1000000, 1/10000 and 1/10000 of arc second respectively.
I have no question, this is a topic for Samsung's wish list (if exists) to update the camera software in the future.
With best regards.

144.title: S7 Nougat Smartlock Trusted Place Positioning Too Accurate!

 There doesn't seem to be a way of specifying a range and so I would expect a sensible default value of a few tens or low hundreds of metres to have been set. 155.title: Major GPS issues with new Galaxy S20
155.content:
My new S20 has very slow and unreliable GPS lock issues.  Google Maps & Waze frequently show my location 1-2 miles away even outdoors in clear conditions.  GPS games also show the incorrect location or jump around frequently.  Sometimes a reboot fixes the issue temporarily but eventually it returns.  I didn't have this issue with the S10, this is really a terrible bug to have in a new flagship phone!  Is there an incoming fix or information on this problem?
 Update on 3/15/2020: 
I chatted with a Samsung support person via the chat option on the website.  They had me calibrate my GPS from the Edge menu.  Note that on my phone I first had to enable the edge menu.  Once enabled swipe left to bring out the menu, and most importantly go to the little dots in the lower left and swipe again to get the "second level" edge menu (or second page).  Poor UI but it's there- a second page that has "Calibarate" Tally Counter, Flashlight, Surface level and Ruler.  Choose Calibrate and move phone in a figure 8 to calibrate.  I will retest out in the field and report back.
Note that on some carriers (not verizon) you can enter *#0*#, then tap Sensor, then Selftest under magnetic sensor and ensure it says "Pass".  Fingers crossed!
 Update 3/18- none of the solutions in this thread has worked reliably for me.  If you google "galaxy s20 gps issue" you'll see growing coverage of this issue so hopefully it will get a solution soon.
 Update 3/29- I received a system update a few days ago (G981U1UEU1ATCH/G981U1OYM1ATCH/G981U1UEU1ATCH)  but unfortunately the problem is still
occuring and not fixed. 
Update 5/10- It's working much better now, some sort of update must have been pushed and in conjuction with keeping 5G off I'm finding GPS pretty reliable now so am closing this issue.  Hopefully it will get fine tuned and even better.
 Update 9/15/2020- I see many people are having this issue again so am unmarking it as solved.  I am not experiencing the issue anymore but others are.
